gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.util
Class XMLDateTime

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.util.DateTimeBase
      gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.util.XMLDateTime
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class XMLDateTime
extends DateTimeBase

Describe an XML schema DateTime.

The format is defined by W3C XML Schema Recommendation and ISO8601 i.e (-)CCYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS(.SSSSS)(Z|(+|-)hh:mm)

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

XMLDateTime

public XMLDateTime()

XMLDateTime

public XMLDateTime(short[] values)
Constructs a XML Schema DateTime instance given all the values of the different date and time (but not time zone) fields.

By default a DateTime is not UTC, and is local. To set a timezone, you need to separately call DateTimeBase.setZone(short, short).

Parameters:
values - an array of shorts that represent the different fields of Time.
See Also:
setValues(short[])

XMLDateTime

public XMLDateTime(long dateAsLong)
61 * Creates a new XML Schema DateTime instance from a long that represents a 62 * Date. No time zone information is set. 63 *

64 * By default a DateTime is not UTC, and is local. To set a timezone, you 65 * need to separately call DateTimeBase.setZone(short, short). 66 * 67 * @param dateAsLong 68 * java.util.Date represented as a long. 69

78 * By default a DateTime is not UTC, and is local. To set a timezone, you 79 * need to separately call DateTimeBase.setZone(short, short). 80 * 81 * @param dateRef 82 * a java.util.Date to convert. 83

setValues

public void setValues(short[] values)
113 * Sets all the fields to the values provided in an Array. The Array must 114 * be at least eight entries long. Extra entries are ignored. The order of 115 * entries in the array is as follows: 116 *
    117 *
  • century
    • 118 *
  • year
    • 119 *
  • month
    • 120 *
  • day
    • 121 *
  • hour
    • 122 *
  • minute
    • 123 *
  • second
    • 124 *
  • millisecond
    • 125 *
126 * If a Time Zone is to be specified, it has to be set separately by using 127 * setZone. A time zone 128 * previously set will not be cleared. 129 * 130 * @param values 131 * An array of shorts containing the values for the DateTime 132
